body: LBs distribute traffic across servers to prevent any single one from overloading. Key for high availability!
Vertical: Adding more RAM/CPU to one machine. Horizontal: Adding more machines. Horizontal is king for scale!
Store frequently accessed data in memory (like Redis) to reduce DB load and speed up response times. ⚡
Splitting a large DB into smaller, faster pieces (shards) across different servers. Essential for huge datasets.
A network of servers globally that serves static content (images/JS) from the location closest to the user.
